page.title: 01Introducing the area
page.content: This area covers most of the North West part of{Nuneaton.}Since it excludes the main shopping area of the town it can be categorised into three main parts: housing estates; farmland; and wasteland created largely by disused pits. As this land becomes stable enough the trend is to use it and adjoining farmland for new private housing estates. The area is dissected by the{Coventry Canal, River Anker and {London-Glasgow railway.}North of Nuneaton town centre, rising out of the{Trent Valley}is an outcrop of hard pre-Cumbria rock which has led to large quarries being developed, scarring the landscape. A large council estate dominates the skyline of the South facing slopes. In the centre of this estate lies a lovely natural pool which has been landscaped into a park.
